section.title: Sample Missions
section.para: The GMAT distribution includes more than 30 sample missions. These samples show how to apply GMAT to problems ranging from the Hohmann transfer to libration point station-keeping to trajectory optimization. To locate and run a sample mission:

listitem.para: Navigate to the samples folder located in the GMAT root directory.
Double-click a script file of your choice.

section.para: To run optimization missions, you will need MATLAB and the MATLAB Optimization Toolbox or the internal libVF13Optimizer plugin. These are proprietary libraries and are not distributed with GMAT. MATLAB connectivity is not yet fully supported in the Mac and Linux, and therefore you cannot run optimization missions that use MATLABâ€™s fmincon optimizer on those platforms. See for details on configuring the MATLAB optimizer.
